comment: There is a reading every week that you have there will be a discussion/quiz on in class. Readings aren't terrible. She cares a lot about her students. She was at a conference for two weeks then was sick so we didn't have class for like a month. We had one big assignment but manageable.

This class consisted of busy work. Most other classes dropped a few assignments because it is too much to do while doing clinicals. She is passionate about cultural relevance, but I did not learn anything new in this class. She does not respond to emails. I have gotten a good grade, but it just did not enjoy this class. She grades harshly too.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Skip class? You won't pass.--So many papers

comment: She was a little disorganized, but I also took her class the first time that she taught a summer semester (so it was excusable). She's an easy grader, and she is decent when it comes to her being accessible.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--SO MANY PAPERS--Caring

comment: Super nice! You can tell she really cared about her students. She was a pretty easy grader and you can tell she loves what she does.
rating_tags: Respected--Get ready to read--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS

comment: Honestly, I loved her! Such a nice woman and can tell she genuinely cares. I took her for a maymester and thought it would be awful! She definitely made it a lot better. Super organized and understanding!

LOVED Professor Thornton! She provides realistic material and information to use in the classroom. There is a lot of reading assignments, but they are actually interesting. I learned so much by the reading and discussion with Professor Thornton. Please take her if you have the chance. I hope to take her again before I graduate!
She is a very knowledgeable and passionate professor. I could tell that she enjoys teaching. I was very inspired by this class and I learned very useful advice about education.

She is really unorganized, and she never stops talking. Class usually runs over time because of lack of planning. She responds to emails, and she is passionate about what she teaches. Assignments and projects are really easy.
